result.execSummary:
The defendant Jevonte J Hegwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
-  Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and restitution, if ordered,  from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- No contact with firearms.
- Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- No contact with victim.
- Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jevonte J Hegwood

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jevonte J Hegwood in court.  John E. Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Jevonte J Hegwood in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Benjamin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. 
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
-  Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges and restitution, if ordered,  from bail on deposit.  If there is no posted bail the defendant is to pay the costs and surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 16, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jevonte J Hegwood in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 2:
On state's motion and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Jury trial date vacated.

.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jevonte J Hegwood in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting a plea hearing date prior to the jury trial date.
Case adjourned for a plea hearing in branch 36.

  Plea hearing scheduled for March 16, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jevonte J Hegwood in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 23, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ABJ dob 9/4/88

Defendant Jevonte J Hegwood in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Jevonte J Hegwood in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2017 at 08:30 am.
